result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus L Reynolds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus L Reynolds is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marcus L Reynolds was found guilty of Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes:
11/18/21 Crt orders 3 mo conditional jail stayed for use as needed at the discretion of the agent.
5/11/22 Crt orders def is to serve 3 mo jail as a condition of probation.
6/28/22 Court will order Defendant to be released on July 5, 2022 and stay the remainder balance of the conditional jail time. Court orders Defendant must be on remote breath monitoring upon release. DOC given one week to obtain the necessary equipment.

charges.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus L Reynolds

records.addlTxt: DISCHARGE - REGULAR

*** IN CUSTODY ***

09:08 AM Defendant appeared.  ADA Lexi Keyes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Jessica Reindl in the Courtroom at counsel table. Statement by Defendant. Statement by Agent Reindl. Statement by ADA Keyes and Agent Reindl regarding recommendation. Court will order Defendant to be released on July 5, 2022 and stay the remainder balance of the conditional jail time. Court orders Defendant must be on remote breath monitoring upon release. DOC given one week to obtain the necessary equipment.
Review hearing on June 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
